lessons.title: React Component - Hello World!
lessons.objective: Display Hello World! in a web page.
lessons.explanation: We want to display 'Hello World!' in an html span element to display it on a web page.
lessons.task: Type the span tags with Hello World! inside.
descriptions: Displaying Hello World! is often the first task when learning a new programming language or framework.
A span tag is used for an element that flows like a line of text.

experiments.comment: Why does Goodbye World! seem so dark?
The div tag is actually more common than span, but span is ideal for text.

lessons.title: React Component - Arrow Function Body
lessons.objective: Write the function body to display Hello World! in a web page.
lessons.explanation: Practice writing the entire function body.
lessons.task: Type function body with a return, paranthesis, and the span tags with Hello World! inside.
descriptions: Wrap jsx code with parenthesis ( ) to keep the code organized.
Use the full function body - with curly braces { } and a return statement - to make it easy to edit the component.
We will always end statements with semicolons ; to be consistent.

experiments.comment: This is the react component with the minimal code.
However, it is better to keep the full syntax to allow easy editing.

lessons.title: React Component - Arrow Function Parameters
lessons.explanation: Practice writing the empty parameters for a react component.
lessons.task: Type the props parameter with an empty object type.
descriptions: React components take a single parameter usually named props.
An empty object type { } is used for a simple component that doesn't need any attributes.

experiments.comment: It is possible to create a react component without any parameter.

lessons.title: React Component - Entire Component
lessons.objective: Write the entire component to display Hello World! in a web page.
lessons.task: Type the const component with the arrow function body from before.
descriptions: The App component is the main react component and contains all the other components of the app.
The const keyword declares a variable that never changes.
The export keyword allows other files to use a declaration.

experiments.comment: Some old react code may use class components, but class components are obsolete and have been replaced by react hooks.

lessons.title: React Component - Import React
lessons.objective: Write the required import statement for a react component
lessons.explanation: Practice writing the import react statement.
descriptions: The import keyword is used to include code from another file or module.
Every file that contains jsx code must import the 'react' module.

experiments.comment: Sometimes you will need to import additional items from the react module.
